content.html:
The first electronic toy I remember is a calculator that had a '+1' button. It wasn't a toy actually, it was just my Dad's calculator. I would press the '+1' button to make the number bigger for long stretches at a time. I would have been very young, four years or less. It had a red front and black back. It was rectangular and required four (4) AA batteries; was four AA's wide (maybe three). The +1 button was on top, and white.

The next one I recall is a Talking Whiz Kid, made by V-Tech beginning in 1986. I can easily relive the sound of 'Yes, you are right,' but I don't remember what it said when an error was made. Hmmm. Maybe just 'No, try again.' It was not the sound of hitting the ball out of bounds in Sega's "Great Golf" from 1987, though that comes to mind!

I had a lot of SMS games. I remember playing Phantasy Star and someone (Dad) making maps of the dungeons on graph paper.

I would press the '+1' button to make the number bigger for long stretches at a time. I would have been very young, four years or less. It had a red front and black back. It was rectangular and required four (4) AA batteries; was four AA's wide (maybe three). The +1 button was on top, and white.The next one I recall is a Talking Whiz Kid, made by V-Tech beginning in 1986. I can easily relive the sound of 'Yes, you are right,' but I don't remember what it said when an error was made. Hmmm. Maybe just 'No, try again.' It was not the sound of hitting the ball out of bounds in Sega's "Great Golf" from 1987, though that comes to mind!I had a lot of SMS games. I remember playing Phantasy Star and someone (Dad) making maps of the dungeons on graph paper.

content.html:
Shaq pantomimed the zoo gorilla, wolrdwide average, reaction to meeting Shaq.

Surreal moment.

OG: rapt. inattention, diminutive.

Shaq: rapt.

content.html:
A friend of mine said to me this evening, "When I'm out in public I still need to be careful." Consummate businessman.

"I know, right?" I said. "I live only a couple doors down from you but I am living a completely different experience."

He nodded.

"The way I see it, there are two paths. Play it safe, or conquer the village."
content.value: A friend of mine said to me this evening, "When I'm out in public I still need to be careful." Consummate businessman."I know, right?" I said. "I live only a couple doors down from you but I am living a completely different experience."He nodded."The way I see it, there are two paths. Play it safe, or conquer the village."

content.html:
I played pool today. Just forget that happened.

Interrupted a cursing jay walker (it was later and indoors) to state that he was rude! He grumbled about bums, cursedly calling 'asshole' while not looking at me directly but rather at the person situated behind the bar. Talking to me, oh yes, he spake bullshit once. He was, in fact, being rude to myself and my associate only for being in sight when he was originally interrupted. By me.

"You are a very rude person," I said loudly, while looking directly at him.

His associates at the bar immediately began apologizing to me.

Such is life, and his drunken game.

I implied that I along with many others present were all assholes and listening. Couple of laughs around. He less-frowned. I described the modern contrivance, the automated and lit cross-walk.

He was speechless. His friend got it and asked if I was in that car earlier.

"Yes," says I.

"Don't mind him", says he.

Met people. Bought beer for two strangers (coors light; other side of the bar). Drank with an entire bar full of people for eight (8) minutes before the bar closed at 11pm. Good times.
